moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 c5 5: The starting position for all the games.
moves.9. Nb5: My opponent removes the Knight from danger.
moves.11. g3: White wants me to initiate the exchange.
moves.12. gxh4: ...and White completes the exchange. At this point, I should play ...B-R4 to prevent the Knight fork.
moves.13... Kd7: Now at least White's Knight can't get back out via B7.
moves.14. Nxa8: Oh well. I can win the Knight, so i'll only be down an Exchange. I'll fight on for a bit.
moves.14... Kd6: To clear a square for the B, so I can discover an attack on the Knight.
moves.15. Bg2: This B is en prise, but I'm too intent on winning the Knight to notice immediately.
moves.15... Bd7: I follow up with my plan. The Knight is trapped.
moves.16. Rd1: White guards his other Knight, presumably to castle without it falling to ...BxN.
moves.16... Rxg2: I capture the loose B, and as White can do nothing to stop me from winning the Knight as well, White resigns rather than play out an endgame down 2 pieces for a Rook.
